alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued August 22 at 5:54PM MST until August 22 at 6:45PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 645 PM MST. * At 553 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Casa Grande to near Blackwater to near Magma to near Queen Valley, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 163 and 193. AZ Interstate 8 near mile marker 176. US Highway 60 between mile markers 181 and 215. Locations impacted include... Mesa, Chandler, Gilbert, Casa Grande, Apache Junction, Gold Canyon, Sun Lakes, East Mesa, Maricopa, Queen Creek, Gold Camp, San Tan Village Mall, San Tan Valley, Seville, and Freestone Park. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
